com.abc

Class Account

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.abc.Account

  • public class Account
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the object for the Account. It contains an ArrayList of Transactions which describe the activity inside the account. Functions for deposit and withdraw add new transactions.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CHECKING 
      static int MAXI_SAVINGS 
      static int SAVINGS 
      java.util.List<Transaction> transactions

      Account(int accountType)
      The constructor for an Account.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDailyInterest()
      This function automatically calculates and adds the correct amount of interest for that day
      boolean checkTenDaysBack()
      This function returns true if the most recent transaction happened more than 10 days ago.
      void deposit(double amount)
      This function creates a new transaction adding a double representing money to the Account's balance..
      int getAccountType()
      A function to get the Account's type
      double getBalance()
      This function returns the balance of this account.
      double interestEarnedPerYear()
      This function calculates the amount of interest that will be generated per year given the type of account this is and the amount of money deposited.
      double sumTransactions()
      This function loops through the LinkedList of Transactions and returns the sum.
      void withdraw(double amount)
      This function creates a new transaction removing a given double representing money from the Account's balance.

      • transactions

    • Constructor Detail

      • Account

        public Account(int accountType)
        The constructor for an Account. It takes an integer representing which type of Account it should be.
        Parameters:
        accountType - An integer representing one of 0 ,1 or 2. Any other value will default to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • deposit

        public void deposit(double amount)
        This function creates a new transaction adding a double representing money to the Account's balance.. The balance is also updated during this process.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of money to be deposited into the Account. This value is not allowed to have more than 2 decimal places as it is impossible to have 0.001 dollars, for example.

      • withdraw

        public void withdraw(double amount)
        This function creates a new transaction removing a given double representing money from the Account's balance. It is not possible to use this function to go below 0.00 balance
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of money to be withdrawn from the Account. This value is not allowed to have more than 2 decimal places as it is impossible to have 0.001 dollars, for example.

      • getBalance

        public double getBalance()
        This function returns the balance of this account.
        Returns:
        A double representing the amount of money in this account.

      • interestEarnedPerYear

        public double interestEarnedPerYear()
        This function calculates the amount of interest that will be generated per year given the type of account this is and the amount of money deposited.
        Returns:
        A double representing the amount of interest that will be generated per year given the type of account and amount of money deposited

      • addDailyInterest

        public void addDailyInterest()
        This function automatically calculates and adds the correct amount of interest for that day

      • checkTenDaysBack

        public boolean checkTenDaysBack()
        This function returns true if the most recent transaction happened more than 10 days ago.
        Returns:
        A boolean value representing whether or not the most recent transaction happened more than 10 days ago or not

      • sumTransactions

        public double sumTransactions()
        This function loops through the LinkedList of Transactions and returns the sum.
        Returns:
        A double representing the sum of all Transactions. This is effectively the same as the balance.

      • getAccountType

        public int getAccountType()
        A function to get the Account's type
        Returns:
        An integer representing one of 0 ,1 or 2
